WorkItem.Description:
Per http://elitistjerks.com/f78/t83763-proc_items_needle_encrusted_scorpion_et_al/#2
 
Diffs from current:
 - Needle-Encrusted Scorpion - 50 sec ICD instead of 45 sec
 - Revered/Exalted Ashen Verdict rings - 1 PPM instead of 10% proc
 - Deathbringer's Will - 'Proc rate is "about" 50% - might be a bit lower (say 45%) but it's definitely in that ballpark.' (quote from site)
 
Whispering Fanged Skull appears correct.
 
I don't know if Heartpierce is right or not.  I haven't poked around in any modules that would use it.
 
This thread seems a likely place to track for future melee trinkets as Aldriana is a very well respected melee theorycrafter.
WorkItem.Summary: [Items] Incorrect modeling on some ICC procs

Comments.Message: Did anyone confirm these are the correct values for these trinkets, I don't want to make the change without a double-check.

NES - Test this once I get home (have a druid [unless i've already deleted it already; hoping it's still in my bank] and a hunter with it)

Ashen Verdict rings - again I have a melee, dps caster, and healing version of the exalted. I can test all three as well

Deathbringer's Will - I'm not able to find any information on proc chance on any of the database sites. Wowhead is the only one that states it is a server-side script on the proc. Again I can try to get an estimate on the proc chance.

If the numbers very posted by Aldriana you shouldn't really need to look for another confirmation.
And incidentally, I came here to report that the NES trinket seems overrated - maybe it's related to the wrong proc rate?

It's not a bad thing to double-check Aldriana's numbers.  He/she is no more infallible than the rest of us.  In particular, when it comes to areas of contention like trinket proc rates, it's probably better to do so just to better ensure a consensus.

Aldriana is compiling results of hundreds of hours of combatlog tests done by EJ forum users, and his results are reviewed by the community.  As far as WOW is concerned, you will not get more reliable information.  Specifically, the proc rate of ICC items was kept unreleased for months, until sufficient statistical proof was gathered to get enough confidence. You will not be able to repeat this process by yourself and you will be most likely wasting your time.
It's true there is always a chance of error, but it's small enough that I would just do the change as fast as possible and worry about it later.  For now, it looks like you have wrong data for items used by many classes for almost a year...
I was checking to see if heartpierce invigoration is modeled incorrectly (or at all)?
